wikipedia_page.main: Angela Rosalind Runcie, Baroness Runcie (née Turner; 23 January 1932  –  12 January 2012) was a classical pianist and the wife of Robert Runcie, Archbishop of Canterbury.

response: Runcie's wife, Rosalind, whom he married on 5 September 1957, was well known as a pianist. They had two children: James Runcie, a novelist, and Rebecca Runcie, as well as four grandchildren: Rosie, Charlotte (currently a journalist at The Daily Telegraph), Matthew and Edward. Rosalind Runcie died on 12 January 2012.
* Rosalind Runcie, pianist and wife of the Archbishop of Canterbury

The last show was transmitted on 21 January 2007 – a run of over 47 years. For most of this time, it was presented by the original creator, Alan Keith, who continued up to the age of 94. After his death in 2003, Richard Baker presented the show. Holiday guest presenters included Evelyn Barbirolli, Rosalind Runcie, Earl Spencer and Ursula Vaughan Williams.

Runcie was born in Cambridge, the son of Robert Runcie, the former Archbishop of Canterbury, and Rosalind Runcie,  a classical pianist.Humphrey Carpenter, Robert Runcie: The Reluctant Archbishop. Hodder & Stoughton, 1996, pp. 269–272. . He was educated at the Dragon School in Oxford,Desmond Devitt (ed.), A Diversity of Dragons, 2003. pp. 51–52, "An affair to remember". Marlborough College, and Trinity Hall, Cambridge.
*Rosalind Runcie, 79, British pianist, widow of Robert Runcie.
